title: Branton
subtitle: Where contemporary design meets timeless furniture craftsmanship

sections.title: The Challenge
sections.content: Branton, a London-based design firm serving major industrial clients like McCormick and 3M, needed brand treatments that would resonate with their manufacturing audience while showcasing their design innovation. I was brought on to create visual identity pieces that balanced industrial strength with creative sophistication.

sections.title: The Approach
sections.content:
I used Houdini's procedural capabilities to create dynamic brand treatments that embody precision and strength. The procedural approach allowed me to generate multiple variations while maintaining consistencyâ€”perfect for a firm serving diverse industrial clients.

I developed a visual system using geometric forms and industrial materials as inspiration, creating animations and still frames that could adapt across applications. The procedural workflow meant I could quickly iterate and customize treatments for different contexts while keeping the core brand essence intact.

sections.title: The Result
sections.content:
The final brand treatments successfully positioned Branton as both technically sophisticated and creatively innovative. The procedural approach delivered a flexible visual system that works across digital and print applications, from pitch decks to trade show materials.

The work helped Branton communicate their value to industrial clients: just as they bring design thinking to manufacturing, the brand treatments brought creative innovation to industrial aesthetics.
